channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: When Chasing More Dividends Leaves You With Less
item.description: High-yield equity funds are popular, but the pursuit of a large payout can sink your portfolio.

item.title: ‘This flies in the face of my morals and ethics’: My father cut my sisters out of his six-figure estate. Should I push back?
item.description: “Although there is time for him to change his mind, my dad is a stubborn man.”

item.title: Morgan Stanley Is Fined Over First Republic Insider Sales
item.description: Massachusetts securities regulator found several breakdowns in the bank’s approval and monitoring of possible insider trading.

item.title: What to make of Nvidia’s pullback
item.description: Also: A moment truth for Boeing, and what to do before the Federal Reserve cuts interest rates.

item.title: Why Now May Be the Time to Invest in Small-Cap Stocks
item.description: Lower interest rates and a stabilizing economy could fuel a rally in smaller companies after years of lagging performance.

item.title: ‘You have to go where your fans are’: NFL commissioner Roger Goodell defends moving games to streaming platforms
item.description: The NFL now makes roughly $10 billion a year from its broadcasting deals, up from about $3 billion in 2010

item.title: Pandemic Darling Moderna Needs a Reality Check
item.description: Moderna is spending aggressively to broaden the uses of its mRNA technology. Investors are losing patience.

item.title: Broadcom’s most active bonds perk up as stock falls after earnings
item.description: Broadcom Inc.’s stock slid 9% Friday, but its two most-active bonds were signaling that bondholders were unfazed by the company’s latest earnings repo...

item.title: How Nvidia Became the Market's Most Important Stock, in Charts
item.description: The graphics chipmaker lost nearly $280 billion in market value Tuesday, the most ever by a company in a single session.

item.title: Bitcoin continues to fall as crypto-market sentiment shifts into ‘extreme fear’
item.description: Bitcoin briefly fell below $54,000 on Friday.
